channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2023111237
item.description:
Report X-2023111237

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-19
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found mishandled on non-compatible belt rollers. No overhead scans on ftrack. Package removed from operations posthaste. DescribePack: Package was not oriented upward despite vented cap warnings on outer packaging. Two of four 5L plastic jerricans lost 0.3 gal of fluid due to lying on their side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. The tote used for transporting damaged package and spillage was lined with a hazbag.

item.title: Report X-2023111231
item.description:
Report X-2023111231

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023111231 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used. 2. X-2023111232 SequenceEvent: Admin noted leaking hazmat package on its side at APA / qa intercept / in overhead discharge chute at 21:30, 10/18. Package was removed from operations, placed in lined tote, and staged with note down at HMPA staging pallet. Please note that hazmat 786532313790 was impacted but experienced no internal spillage. DescribePack: At least two of four 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from internal corrosion of safety seals below cap closures due to mishandling. The package was sent up onto the overhead on the Unload and was diverted to the qa intercept / overhead discharge chute. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, tote lined to catch all spillage, and ventilation used.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz pkg found leaking on HMPA pallet. upon inspection it was discovered the inner container SINK & SURFACE CLEANER SANITIZER was cracked/punctured on one of the lower corners of the package, causing the internal leakage. DescribePack: There was a small crack/puncture on the lower corner of the inner bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE and ventilation used.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz pkg found leaking on HMPA pallet. upon inspection it was discovered the inner container SINK & SURFACE CLEANER SANITIZER was cracked where the handle was (along the seam at the bottom of the handle), causing the internal leakage. DescribePack: The seam along the bottom of the handle of the inner container was cracked, causing the internal leakage. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2023111269
item.description:
Report X-2023111269

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-22
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a plastic pail was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: Plastic pail had a loose cap, resulting in leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found on in tote on HMPA staging pallet with no context. Ftrack shows load area activity: dispatch scan to trailer 841684, 11/15, 22:29. Please note that the hazmat package under TRK 786384555267 was also impacted by spillage from this incident, though experienced no spillage itself and contained identical hazardous material (see HESS 113592). DescribePack: One of three 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 0.4 gallon of fluid due to a compromised (half-torn) seal under the cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

  • Description: 1 x metal can UN1263 leaked due to loose lid. packed in 4G fibreboard outer packaging. cleaned n and secured in salvage drum pending further disposition. Outer package also contained a metal can of locktite UN1866 which did not leak but was leaked on by the paint.

item.title: Report X-2023110996
item.description:
Report X-2023110996

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CN mechanical employee observed icing around the protective housing of tank car # UTLX 957945 along with a gas type odor while performing switching operations at the CN Harrison Yard in Memphis, TN. The CN Dangerous Goods Team was notified and responded to the rail yard to investigate. Upon arrival, the DGO observed a large ice buildup around the protective housing. Upon opening the housing, ice buildup was observed around the B end liquid valve. The valve was found to not be in the fully closed position with its securement plug less than tool tight (could turn by hand) allowing the tank cars contents to leak out. The liquid valve handle was hand tightened (approximately 1/4 turn) stopping the leak. The securement plug was removed, thread sealant applied, reinstalled and tightened with a pipe wrench. The railcar was released onto destination.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box containing a ID800 was presented to the MEMH Dangerous Goods Office with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained six glass bottles and two of the bottles were shattered and spilled all of their contents. The remaining contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for a amended declaration for movement.

  • Description: On Nov 6th a package was discovered leaking during the PM sort. The package contained UN1133, Adhesives, 3, III in a metal can. The bottom of the metal can appears to have been damaged causing the liquid inside to leak out. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper contacted for an amended shippers declaration.

item.description:

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box containing fully regulated hazmat found in tote on HMPA staging pallet. No UNPOP markings found on box (cannot determine whether repack was attempted via spidr image) and (Limey Delimer) listed as technical name vs (urea sulphate). DescribePack: Two of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost at least 0.3 gallon of fluid due to loose cap closures. Please note that cap closures are vented and at least one orientation arrow label was found on the outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SDS consulted, PPE donned, and ventilation used.

The plastic pial was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: Upon examination, it was concluded that the lid had sustained a crack as a result of being dropped from the rollers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the plastic pail's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023110634
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet. SDS requested from shipper's local and corporate offices. DescribePack: At least one of four 1 gallon plastic bottles of Veolia L255.4000 Sodium hydroxide solution 1N lost 0.1 gal of fluid due to inadequate preparation for transport. Despite paper dunnage sitting atop bottles and thin plastic bag enclosing bottles, cap closures failed to contain content and bottles were discovered consistently soaked with fluid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned; SDS consulted and ventilation ready if needed.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The stained package was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the QA area. No other information is available. DescribePack: One of the six bottles in the carton leaked at the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a lined tote and brought to the QA area for processing. The spillage was minor and confined to the carton.
